title: Official Gazette Chat
description: The Official Gazette Chat is an end-to-end solution that optimizes search in large textual databases, such as the Official Gazette of Belo Horizonte, using Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG). It assists civil servants and professionals in navigating extensive documents, providing efficient searches and saving time.

team.name: Alvaro Jose Lopes
team.bio: Contributed to the data ingestion stage, from design to implementation.

team.name: Bernardo Marques Costa
team.bio: Worked on the design and implementation of the tool, from data ingestion to creating the final application.

team.name: Cecília Nunes Sedenho
team.bio: Contributed with testing different language models and integration between data ingestion and model interaction.

team.name: Laura Fernandes Camargos
team.bio: Worked on testing RAG configurations and implementing the frontend of the final application.

team.name: Pedro Augusto Monteiro Delgado
team.bio: Managed the team and project, in addition to contributing to application testing.

title: BEMU
description: The project collects questions from Brazilian university entrance exams to evaluate multimodal AIs in Portuguese, combining PDF parsing, AI models, and LaTeX converters. The result is five datasets with over 5,000 questions, making benchmarks more representative.

references.title: Going beyond English: expanding the horizon of multimodal AI evaluations

team.name: Luísa Shimabucoro
team.bio: ML researcher focused on NLP and Computer Vision.

team.name: Gabriel Merlin
team.bio: Machine Learning and Deep Learning specialist focused on Time Series.

team.name: André Mitri
team.bio: Researcher in Time Series and Representation Learning with web scraping experience.

team.name: Leticia Marchezi
team.bio: NLP researcher with experience in text extraction using multimodal models.

team.name: Otávio F. Coletti
team.bio: Developer specialized in PDF parsing and structured data extraction.

title: EcoVision
description: EcoVision applies computer vision for safety in waste sorting, identifying dangerous objects in real-time.

team.name: Artur De Vlieger Lima
team.bio: Developer specialized in computer vision techniques and real-time object detection.

team.name: Lucas de Souza Brandão
team.bio: Expert in computer vision models for object recognition.

team.name: Gustavo Sampaio
team.bio: Project coordinator with experience in computer vision for social impact.

team.name: Pedro L. Figueiredo
team.bio: Engineer specialized in implementing YOLO models for object detection.

title: TTS-AutoTuning
description: This project involves creating an application to automate the fine-tuning process of text-to-speech models based on Portuguese audio data.

team.name: Antonio Micheli
team.bio: Worked on the automatic evaluation of the generated audios and on the implementation of the final application.

team.name: Arthur Ramos
team.bio: Worked on automating the fine-tuning of the Orpheus model.

team.name: Caio Petroncini
team.bio: Worked on automating the fine-tuning of the XTTS model.

team.name: Lucas De Souza
team.bio: Led the team, worked on preprocessing the raw audios and implementing the final application.

team.name: Pedro Soares
team.bio: Worked on the preprocessing of raw audios.

title: BoneCheck
description: AI system for early osteoporosis detection via panoramic radiograph classification.

team.name: Gabriel Merlin
team.bio: Led the team and worked on ensemble training.

team.name: Ademir Guimarães
team.bio: Worked on base model and ensemble training.

team.name: Andre De Mitri
team.bio: Worked on data preprocessing and training of models.

team.name: Matheus Giraldi
team.bio: Worked on training base models.

team.name: Matheus Lenzi
team.bio: Worked on training base models.

team.name: Yasmin Oliveira
team.bio: Worked on data preprocessing and LLM integration.

title: SpellNet
description: Computer vision app for real-time fingerspelling recognition in Libras and ASL.

team.name: Cecilia Nunes
team.bio: Led the team and worked on preprocessing video data for dataset creation.

team.name: Daniel Dantas
team.bio: Worked on model implementation and fine-tuning.

team.name: João Pedro Viguini
team.bio: Worked on model implementation and fine-tuning.

team.name: Gabriel Iamato
team.bio: Worked on dataset preprocessing.

team.name: Matheus Vicente
team.bio: Worked on dataset preprocessing.

team.name: Bernardo Marques
team.bio: Built the interface for real-time recognition.

title: VestAgents
description: Multi-agent tool for generating Brazilian university entrance exam questions using LLMs and RAG.

team.name: Álvaro José Lopes
team.bio: Worked on the implementation of a few-shot prompt structuring agent.

team.name: Artur De Vlieger
team.bio: Worked on the implementation of a few-shot prompt structuring agent.

team.name: Fabrício Salomon
team.bio: Implemented a search agent and participated in the evaluation phase.

team.name: Letícia Marchezi
team.bio: Managed the team, developed general-purpose agents and contributed to the evaluation process.

team.name: Luís Jorge
team.bio: Worked on the implementation of a search agent for exam questions.

team.name: Otávio Coletti
team.bio: Implemented a web scraping agent to retrieve support texts.
